A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: When Luke just casually tossed the light saber over his shoulder as a gag joke\, my heart sank. Between that and all the other \"jokes\" (like the sappy phone call intro)\, gimmicks\, and cheesy one liners\, it almost felt like a spoof. I also didn't like how Rian Johnson seemed to get a kick out story bait and switches: you think Kylo and Rey are enemies? Ah ha! Watch this! Now they have teamed up! But wait! Now they are enemies again!! But wait\, now--\nAfter a while as an audience member I started not trusting anything in front of my eyes\, and because of that\, I constantly felt like there was nothing to grab on to\, nothing to ground myself with story wise. It was a bit like following a social media thread: stimulus\, distraction\, stimulus\, distraction\, stimulus\, distraction\, rapid fire over and over. This might be why it appealed to certain people; it's like the modern day internet. All flash and cheap thrills\, no substance.
